meta_description: Nauticus is a maritime discovery center located along the waterfront in downtown, Norfolk, VA, offering a unique form of experiential learning for all ages.
hours_text:
# Visit Nauticus

Nauticus is a maritime discovery center located along the waterfront in downtown, Norfolk, VA, offering a unique form of experiential learning for all ages. Through interactive exhibits and STEM to STERN programming, Nauticus uses the museum, Battleship  _Wisconsin_ , sailing center, and Schooner Virginia to tell the story of the maritime environment, industry, and the military. **Look forward to seeing you soon!**

### Visit Nauticus

## Hours + Directions

Admission prices, hours, driving directions, parking information and much more.

Learn More

### Visit Nauticus

## Group Reservations

Planning a classroom tour or a holiday gathering? Nauticus can provide an overview of thought-provoking opportunities for your school or group.

Learn More

### Visit Nauticus

## Battleship _Wisconsin_

Learn more about one of the largest and last battleships ever built by the U.S. Navy!

Learn More

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

  * Wheelchair accessibility throughout the building and on board the main deck of the Battleship  _Wisconsin_.
  * Five on-site handicapped-reserved parking spaces.  
_(Handicapped parking is available on a first come, first served basis. Handicapped parking is unavailable on cruise ship days.)_
  * 1 elevator with second and third floor access.
  * Handicapped-reserved spaces in the Nauticus Theater.
  * Exhibit and movie scripts are available upon request. (check out at the admissions desk).
  * Assisted listening devices available upon request in Nauticus theater. (Please let the theater staff know prior to show starting that you will require the ALD.)
  * Sign Language interpreters can be provided with a minimum of two-weeks notice. Please call The Director of Visitor Operations a (757) 664-1037 to place a request or the Group Sales Manager at (757) 664-1034 for a group visit of 15 or more people.
  * TTY phone available for use at the Admissions desk.
  * Closed-captioned exhibits throughout the building.

### Ship Experience Access Room

Located right off the wardroom on the Battleship  _Wisconsin_ , the Ship Experience Access Room (SEAR) was developed for visitors that want to experience the Battleship, but are unable to physically take the tour. Built in the former Administrative Office of the  _Wisconsin_ , the SEAR creates a virtual tour of the ship through the use of video surveillance equipment.

Thanks to a partnership with IPconfigure, Axis Com...

[](https://104497.blackbaudhosting.com/104497/tickets)

## Maritime Discovery Center

Nauticus is uniquely located along the waterfront in downtown, Norfolk, Virginia, offering a unique form of experiential learning for all ages. Through interactive exhibits and STEM to STERN programming, Nauticus uses the museum, Battleship _Wisconsin_ , sailing center, and Schooner Virginia to tell the story of the maritime environment, industry, and the military.

[Hours & Tickets](https://nauticus.org/visit/hours-tickets/)

[](/explore/museum-exhibits/ "Plan Your Visit")  
---  
  
### [Plan Your Visit](/explore/museum-exhibits/)

Explore interactive and engaging exhibits that tell the maritime of the maritime industry. [Explore Exhibits](/explore/museum-exhibits/)  
  
[](/battleship-exhibits/about-the-battleship/ "Battleship Wisconsin")  
---  
  
### [Battleship Wisconsin](/battleship-exhibits/about-the-battleship/)

Explore the last battleship ever built by the United States Navy. [Learn More](/battleship-exhibits/about-the-battleship/)  
  
[](/sail-nauticus/ "Sail Nauticus")  
---  
  
### [Sail Nauticus](/sail-nauticus/)

Our sailing center is committed to inspiring our community. [Learn More](/sail-nauticus/)  
  
[](https://www.visitnorfolk.com/cruisenorfolk/ "Cruise Norfolk")  
---  
  
### [Cruise Norfolk](https://www.visitnorfolk.com/cruisenorfolk/)

Home to Virginia's only cruise ship program. [Learn More](https://www.visitnorfolk.com/cruisenorfolk/)
